Post-Match Reflections: The 2024 San Diego Padres had a.500 team record after the All-Star break and finished the regular season with 93 wins, the second-most in franchise history.
The team led the majors in hits and batting average and finished with a Petco Park record in home runs.
The Padres rallied back from deficits throughout the season, forming a heart shape with their arms after hitting doubles.
Xander Bogaerts and other players reflected on the absence of Ha-Seong Kim and Joe Musgrove, as well as the late owner Peter Seidler.
Yu Darvish threw almost fine innings but limited to two solo homers by the Padres.
Shohei Ohtani finished the series 4-for-20 with 10 strikeouts, including three times going down swinging.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres' 24-inning scoreless streak ended their season, which was their longest such streak of the season.
The team's 24-inning scoreless streak not only ended their season but also was their longest such streak of the season.
Players attributed their loss to the Dodgers' pitching, particularly Yoshinobu Yamamoto, who shut them down.
The Padres' bats went silent in the final nine frames, failing to score despite consecutive one-out singles in the third inning.
